meanings.definition: A type of construction in which the outer skin carries all or a major part of the stresses.
meanings.sent1: The monocoque design of the airplane made it lightweight and strong.
meanings.sent2: The bicycle frame was built using a monocoque structure for enhanced durability.
meanings.sent3: The monocoque car body looked like a single, solid piece, fooling many onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence acted as a monocoque, bearing the weight of her team's expectations.
meanings.sent5: The monocoque shell of the building protected it from the harsh weather conditions.
